text:
You would need to build your own custom form and submit using the forms api. 

Well. You might be able to use the form embed JavaScript api and some other scripting to implement it.

There are window events that happen that you can trigger off of instead of waiting for 10 seconds. 

There is also a form embed JavaScript api that will allow you to have more ability to trigger things to happen during the form lifecycle. 

Updating a HubSpot form needs a change event to happen. The forms don’t operate like normal form fields. 

I can send some links to stuff when I’m near a computer. It’s out there on the internet and in documentation, just not easy to find
